title.narrative: UNIDO input into Global Sustainable Development Development Report: Economic Growth, Inclusive and Sustainable Industrial Development and Sustainable Consumption and Production

description.narrative: The intergovernmental process comprised of negotiations, meetings and debates on the post-2015 development agenda and Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) is underway with a view to agreeing on an outcome which will be adopted at a Summit of Heads of State and Government level in September 2015. The objective is to agree on a transformative agenda with the focus on poverty eradication and pathways to achieve sustainable development and SDGs by 2030. The strategic positioning of UNIDO in this regard is critical for demonstrating continual relevance of the Organization to the objectives of the new development agenda and for delivering technical cooperation and support to its member states in the decades to come. UNIDO has been invited to lead the preparation of a Chapter 5 on economic growth, inclusive and sustainable industrial development and sustainable consumption and production for the upcoming GSDR2015, which is mandated to support the High Level Political Forum (HLPF), serving as the global apex body on the review of implementation and on accountability for sustainable development http://sustainabledevelopment.un.org/globalsdreport/2015. UNIDO’s leadership on shaping up the content of Chapter 5 for GSDR 2015 provides a unique opportunity for the Organization for higher profiling and greater visibility of its new mandate built around ISID as a new industrial policy strategy for post-2015 industrialization. This is extremely important in order to consolidate the successes achieved thus far in ensuring that ISID is fully reflected in the OWG proposal and the synthesis report of the Secretary-General on the post-2015 development agenda. Given that ISID is now one of the themes of the upcoming GSDR2015, UNIDO is required to lead authoring the corresponding chapter in a comprehensive and inclusive manner. This will include conducting an EGM on inclusive and sustainable industrial development in post-2015 with a view to bringing together UN agencies that are keenly interested in the post-2015 structural transformation agenda and global thought leaders that are prominently known in the field of industrial economics and the global discourse on industrial policies (including green industrial policies for sustainable consumption and production). The objective of the meeting will be to help elaborate and validate the technical content and main messages of the chapter and to provide intellectual leadership and support for the UNIDO efforts to articulate the ISID agenda in the post-2015 development context, including the role of industrialization in achieving the SDGs.
